;香港政府制定了一项雄心勃勃的目标，将碳强度降低 65-到 2030 年，这一数字将比 2005 年减少 70%。考虑到建筑物消耗了该市 90% 的电力，很明显，如果香港要实现其目标并成为一个更加可持续发展的城市，房东及其租户必须共同努力。;

;幸运的是，开发商和租户在选择租赁物业时优先考虑可持续性以及环境、社会和公司治理（ESG）的势头越来越大。

;

;在过去的两年里，我们注意到租户在选择租赁物业时高度重视可持续性和 ESG 考虑因素。他们期望与业主在可持续发展举措上进行更深入的合作，包括能源效率、废物管理和绿色建筑认证。

;

;例如，当香港置地启动其绿色装修和运营认可计划试点项目时，我们预计只有少数租户参与。消息传出后，我们收到了 30 多个加入该计划的请求。

;

;租户现在不仅将办公空间视为必需品，而且将其视为公司 ESG 战略和员工健康计划的一部分，他们愿意为服务付费。据咨询公司仲量联行称，获得绿色认证的香港甲级写字楼的租金最高可高出28%。

;

;一些人呼吁制定绿色租赁，其中包含具有法律约束力的条款，迫使房东和租户遵守具体的同比目标，否则将面临处罚。但此类合同的一个问题是，超出签署人控制范围的条件可能会对绩效产生巨大影响。

;

;例如，由于经济衰退或迫使人们工作的流行病，能源使用量可能会在一年内下降。在家中，然后由于极端天气，第二年飙升。在实践中，这会鼓励房东和租户设定较低的目标，以避免遭受痛苦处罚的威胁。

;

;相反，我们发现，当租户和房东根据谅解备忘录开展工作时，他们能够设定更多目标雄心勃勃、灵活和长期的目标结合在一起。

;

;同样，合同规定的目标鼓励短期思维，将资源集中于实现每年的目标，而牺牲部署投资回收期较长的解决方案。

;

;

;

;例如，这就是为什么香港政府设定了2050年的碳中和目标，而其他主要的全球脱碳目标则设定得更晚。正如房东和租户之间的谅解备忘录所体现的那样，以合作伙伴关系为基础开展工作，使双方能够努力实现有意义的可持续发展。

;

;房东可以提供广泛的 ESG 服务，帮助租户实现其可持续发展目标。照明、太阳能电池板、基于人工智能的能源管理平台、气候控制系统、隔热和防风雨改进等领域的能源效率升级，都是业主最有能力提供的服务的例子。

;

;虽然其中一些服务解决方案可以由租户实施，在大多数情况下，房东采取整栋建筑的方法更容易、更便宜、更有效。房东还可以实施回收和再利用计划，并提供堆肥设施，以鼓励租户减少废物并促进可持续发展。

;

;房东还可以帮助租户获得绿色建筑认证，例如能源与环境设计领导力认证（ LEED）评级系统或建筑环境评估方法（BEAM）Plus。通过获得这些认证，业主可以表明他们对可持续发展的承诺，并在竞争激烈的市场中脱颖而出，同时帮助租户实现其 ESG 目标和报告要求。

;

;香港建筑的重新调试如何使其更加环保

;

;为了让房东、租户以及香港政府实现碳减排目标，现有建筑物必须尽可能可持续地运营。现实情况是，大多数将在 2030 年代末和 2040 年代运营的建筑已经建成。

;

;通过采用“ESG 即服务”模式，业主可以使建筑更加环保，吸引并留住承诺的租户可持续发展，并在竞争激烈的市场中脱颖而出。

;

;租户和房东之间的合作对于实现可持续发展成果和推动业务成功至关重要。通过共同努力，可以为所有利益相关者取得积极成果，包括节省成本、提高 ESG 绩效和更高的市场价值。

;

;如果您想查看我们的更多报告，请考虑。

;

;

;

;继自 2020 年 2 月以来最快的降幅之后，中国 7 月份的出口出现自冠状病毒大流行开始以来的最大收缩。

;

;去年出口下降了 14.5%与去年同期相比，该数字为 2,817.6 亿美元，而 6 月份则下降了 12.4%。

;

;根据 Wind 的领先供应商的数据，7 月份的数字低于预期的下降 4.8%。凯投宏观分析师表示，下降主要是由于基数效应和价格下跌，他们在考虑季节性和出口价格变化时的估计显示，出口量小幅下降环比仅下降 0.9%。

;

;他们补充说，包括中国制造的电动汽车、电池和太阳能电池板在内的绿色技术的强劲出货量正在帮助抵消其他领域的下降。

;凯投宏观 (Capital Economics) 分析师表示，“最近的下跌主要反映了价格下降，而不是成交量下降，成交量仍远高于大流行前的趋势。” “鉴于更广泛的证据表明，随着大流行病扭曲的缓解和货币紧缩对消费者支出的压力，全球商品需求正在下降，我们不相信这种强劲势头会持续下去。”牛津经济研究院首席经济学家路易丝·卢 (Louise Loo) 表示，随着制造商从去年 6 月和 7 月的上海封锁中恢复过来，中国的出口蛋糕是否会随着地缘政治不确定性升温而融化？ h3>;

;野村证券分析师表示，所有主要贸易伙伴的出口再次普遍下降。

;

;对东南亚国家联盟的出口量，该联盟是中国最大的贸易伙伴，也是中国最大的贸易伙伴之一今年早些时候为其出口部门提供了重要支持，7 月份同比下降 21.43%，连续第二个月下降。

;

;与此同时，对欧盟的出口下降了 20.62%野村证券分析师表示，对美国的出口量同比下降了 23.12%，连续第 12 个月下降。

;

;对美国的出口增长再次遭受严重打击。

; >;

;因此，中国对美国的贸易顺差从 6 月份的 287 亿美元扩大到 7 月份的 303 亿美元。

;

;

;

;7 月份进口下降 12.4%同比下降 2011.6 亿美元，较 6 月份下降 6.8% 有所下降。

;

;这也低于 Wind 预测的下降 11.4%，野村证券分析师表示“进口增长”尽管大宗商品和原材料价格上涨，但由于国内需求疲软，进口量远低于预期。

;

;“国内需求最近也有所疲软，7 月份进口量降至今年年初以来的最低水平。但政策支持应该有助于在未来几个月扭转部分疲软局面。”凯投宏观补充道。

;

;凯投宏观分析师表示，考虑到季节性和进口价格变化后，进口量下降了 5.3% %，逐月上升。

;

;“[这扭转了]今年早些时候取得的大部分收益。这表明7月份内需下滑继续加速。”他们补充道。

;

;来自美国的进口增速从-4.2%骤降至-11.4%，这可能反映出美国的严格限制野村证券分析师补充称，半导体出口禁运继续阻碍中国从美国进口商品。

;

;

;

;中国贸易顺差总额升至三个月高位80.6美元7 月份的贸易余额为 706.2 亿美元，而 6 月份为 706.2 亿美元。

;

;“贸易平衡是唯一的正值……从 6 月份的 710 亿美元升至 7 月份的 800 亿美元，主要是因为进口恶化幅度比 6 月份更严重。野村团队表示。

;

;

;

;凯投宏观分析师预计，未来几个月出口将进一步下降，然后在年底触底。

;

;“大多数出口订单指标表明，外国需求的下降幅度比迄今为止海关数据所反映的要大得多。发达经济体消费者支出的近期前景仍然充满挑战，许多经济体今年晚些时候仍面临经济衰退的风险，尽管经济衰退较温和。”他们补充道。

;

;据凯投宏观称，进口可能会下降”，以在未来几个月内收复部分失地。

;

;“据报道，地方官员已被告知要在下月底之前充分利用其特别债券发行配额，这些配额将用于为基础设施支出提供资金。再加上往返中国的国际旅行持续复苏，这应该会在短期内促进大宗商品进口。”他们补充道。

;

;但牛津经济研究院的 Loo 表示，他们预计出口不会出现好转直到明年第一季度，“欧元区消费复苏疲弱、美国潜在衰退以及英国实际收入受到挤压的综合力量给近期前景带来了压力”。

;

;7 月份，中国官方制造业采购经理人指数连续第四个月保持收缩，而服务业和建筑业扩张均放缓。

;

;“加剧、减速、降温”：4中国 7 月活动数据的要点

;

;“[贸易数据]表明增长前景正在恶化。出口收缩恶化意味着生产疲软，而进口迅速恶化则反映出中国国内需求疲软，”野村证券分析师表示。 “展望未来，考虑到房地产行业崩溃和出口萎缩的双重打击，我们预计到 2023 年底，出口将出现类似规模的收缩，而中国经济增长需要更多时间才能反弹。

;

;“由于高估了北京的政策支持并低估了下行压力，过去几周市场似乎变得过于乐观。”

; Wed, 09 Aug 2023 01:20:01 +0800 TSMC to build US$11 billion chip manufacturing plant in Germanyhttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/article/3230440/tsmc-build-us11-billion-chip-manufacturing-plant-germany?utm_source=rss_feed

;为欧盟打造尖端微芯片供应链的努力带来巨大福音台积电周二宣布计划在德国建造一座 100 亿欧元（110 亿美元）的工厂。

;

;该工厂将建在德国东部的德累斯顿，将开始生产用于该公司表示，到 2027 年底将进入汽车行业。

;

;该项目标志着全球领先的先进芯片制造商台积电首次进军欧洲市场。该公司将与德国公司罗伯特·博世 (Robert Bosch) 和英飞凌科技 (Infineon Technologies) 以及荷兰恩智浦半导体 (NXP Semiconductors) 合作。

;

;欧洲政治领导人多年来一直向台积电示好，因为欧盟试图避免各种供应-在冠状病毒大流行期间，链条瓶颈导致部分经济瘫痪。

;

;该集团一直在寻找吸引台湾芯片投资的方法，而不与台湾自治岛政府达成重大交易。

;

;美国和欧洲对中国传统芯片生产日益感到担忧

;

;布鲁塞尔对台北提出的就双边投资协议展开谈判的要求不为所动，欧盟官员公开辩称，自由流动的投资表明不需要达成协议。

;

;不过，他们私下承认，他们担心来自中国的报复。 2016年，布鲁塞尔承诺与中国、香港和台湾单独谈判投资协议。但在人权制裁方面发生争执后，欧盟-中国全面投资协议 (CAI) 陷入了地缘政治炼狱。

;

;虽然这一问题仍未解决，但布鲁塞尔官僚们甚至不愿意提出与台湾签订协议的想法。有观点认为，让所有 27 个欧盟成员国都支持与台湾达成正式贸易或投资协定是​​不可能的。

;

;对于德国来说，台积电的交易为其萎靡不振的工业注入了一剂强心剂。发动机——但要付出代价。德国媒体报道称，政府将为该工厂提供 50 亿欧元的补贴。

;

;在此之前，英特尔宣布计划在德国东部另一座城市马格德堡建设一座价值 300 亿欧元的芯片工厂，该市拥有三分之一的产能。预计政府补贴将覆盖成本。

;

;欧盟称，柏林正在利用布鲁塞尔宽松的国家援助规则，而其疲弱的经济预计今年仅增长 0.3%数据估计。周日，欧盟最大经济体德国的工业生产 6 月份的跌幅超出了经济学家的预期。

;

;该协议还提升了欧盟建设本土半导体行业的努力，因为它希望避开中美科技战，并在未来台湾海峡出现中断的情况下支撑自己的芯片供应。

;

;自 18 个月前俄罗斯入侵乌克兰以来，大量政治资本已投入到使欧盟的供应链更具弹性。作为这一策略的一部分，它希望减少对中国和其他贸易伙伴在关键技术方面的依赖。

;

;现在，来自欧盟成员国的金融资本也开始效仿。台积电的投资是在欧盟最终批准《芯片法案》两周后进行的，该法案旨在“到 2030 年将欧盟在半导体领域的全球市场份额翻一番，从现在的 10% 增加到至少 20%”。

;

;芯片哎哟！日本在台北的帮助下为国产半导体注入活力

;

;欧盟内部市场负责人“对台积电决定与欧盟三大半导体公司一起投资在欧盟建立新的半导体工厂感到非常高兴”蒂埃里·布雷顿 (Thierry Breton) 在社交媒体上发帖。

;

;“这是正在实施的《欧盟芯片法案》——为欧洲（包括欧盟汽车行业）带来更强的供应安全，”布雷顿补充道。

;

;其他欧盟国家官员们语气谨慎，指出台积电在美国亚利桑那州的新工厂推迟开业的部分原因是缺乏熟练工人。他们指出，鉴于这项工作的技术性很强，而且工厂即将在世界各地涌现，因此需要认真考虑技能培训。

;

;德国的风险合作伙伴将创建欧洲半导体制造公司 (European Semiconductor Manufacturing Company) 是一个新实体，其晶圆厂（制造工厂的行业简写）将由台积电 (TSMC) 运营。

;

;巴黎蒙田研究所 (Institut Montaigne) 亚洲项目主任 Mathieu Duchatel 表示，这一消息有利于德国和欧洲的工业雄心，但表明将欧盟芯片生产市场份额翻一番的目标仍然不现实。

;

;“欧盟芯片法案授权豁免国家援助禁令，如果企业和“政府证明晶圆厂项目是‘同类首创’，这是一个宽松的概念，大大放松了欧盟臭名昭著的严格竞争法，”他最近在欧盟新闻门户网站 Euractiv 上发表的一篇文章中写道。

;

;反性暴力危机中心敦促香港隐私监管机构提供更大的保护to people who have struggled to have intimate photographs removed from the internet.

;

;RainLily on Tuesday said that from April 2021 to March 2023, it had received 646 requests for assistance relating to image-based sexual violence. It had helped individuals demand online platforms take down 1,342 photographs of non-consensual intimate content. Almost 1,200 of these images, or 89 per cent, were eventually taken down.

;

;The NGO said many cases sought to remove individual pictures which showed facial features. But according to the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance, the distribution of intimate images without other kinds of personal data is not a violation of the law.

;

;“The Office of the Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data should further review at what level intimate images can be defined as personal data, and assist those experiencing non-consensual distribution of intimate images in a more proactive manner to live up to the public's expectations,” said Jacey Kan Man-Ki, a senior advocacy officer at the group.

;

;The commissioner's office said that generally, if the identity of a relevant individual was ascertained to be an intimate image, it might constitute personal data under the ordinance.

;

;Deputy executive director Doris Chong said RainLily noticed an increase in requests for help to take down intimate pictures online.

;

;“Despite the introduction of specific criminal offences in October 2021, RainLily's frontline experience suggests that those facing non-consensual distribution and threatened distribution of intimate images are still hesitant to report such incidents,” she said.

;

;Kan added that the NGO's service of requesting online platforms remove images could help avoid victims' identities being exposed.

;

;The data showed that most victims were female (71.3 per cent), while around a fifth (22.2 per cent) were male.

;

;Half of the images the NGO dealt with were distributed by people the victims knew, including intimate partners (27.5 per cent) and online acquaintances (15.8 per cent). But one-third of the victims could not identify the person who posted their pictures.

;

;Kan said most of the victims were afraid the pictures would be discovered by their loved ones.

;

;“They worried their families, friends, and colleagues could find those images online. Even if the contents were removed, they would still fear the images being uploaded again and even being body-shamed online, which traumatised the victims,” she said.

;

;Among the 1,342 intimate photographs, 42 per cent of them were found on pornographic sites, nearly a quarter of them were found on social media platforms (25 per cent) and others on search engines (22.7 per cent). While the remaining were found on content farms (5.3 per cent) and image-hosting websites (5 per cent).

;

;However, RainLily revealed various challenges in helping the victims remove the images.

;

;The NGO said content posted on pornographic sites is spread on an “exponential scale” compared to other platforms, and 25 sites never responded to the NGO and took no removal actions.

;

;Nearly 40 per cent of Hong Kong teens exposed to unwanted sexual content: poll

;

;Most of the sites only prohibit material that violates the owner's copyright. But most of the copyright of non-consensual intimate images belong to the “photographer”, creating difficulties in completely removing such content.

;

;The NGO also pointed out that channels on Telegram often posted links to content farm websites. Posts on content farms included non-consensual pictures, the victims' personal information and a fabricated story surrounding the image.

;

;The same content was spread across sub-groups on these channels. These branches have hundreds to thousands of subscribers.

;

;More men report being sexually harassed online than women: survey

;

;“Although these platforms have policies and reporting channels, they do not respond to and deal with removal requests effectively,” Kan said.

;

;The image-based sexual violence-related criminal offences came into effect in 2021. However, the NGO said there were low conviction and prosecution rates.

;

;It said the laws had limitations. For example, there was no legal obligation to remove the distributed content when the perpetrator was charged; the images would only be removed when legal proceedings started, which was too late to stop the pictures from circulating online.

;The owner of a dairy factory near Bergamo in northern Italy has died after shelves carrying thousands of wheels of cheese collapsed and buried him.

;

;All night, rescuers tried to save the man from under the masses of hard Grana Padano cheese, each wheel weighing 40 kilograms.

;

;Giacomo Chiapparini, 74, was buried under the cheeses when a shelf broke in his warehouse creating a domino effect which brought down the cheeses, firefighter Antonio Dusi said.

;

;Rescuers “had to move the cheeses and the shelves by hand,” Dusi said, adding that it “took about 12 hours” to finally find Chiapparini.

;

;The man was working on Sunday evening in the warehouse of his dairy factory in the small town not far from Milan when one of the metal shelves on which the large cheese wheels were ripening collapsed.

;

;Quickly, the high shelves, reaching to the ceiling and stacked to the brim with cheese, fell one after the other until they buried the man, said the spokesman.

;

;The highest shelf stood at 10 metres (33 feet).

;

;It is not clear how the first metal shelf collapsed, though material fatigue or a technical fault are suspected to be the cause.

;

;An investigation is expected to determine whether it was one or several wheels of cheese that killed the man, the spokesman added.

;

;The warehouse, located in the small town of Romano di Lombardia near Bergamo, contained a total of 25,000 wheels of Grana Padano, a hard cheese which resembles Parmesan and is very popular in Italy.

;Malaysia's attorney general has dropped the lead prosecutor in a corruption case involving Deputy Prime Minister Ahmad Zahid Hamid after she applied for early retirement, as critics raise fears of political meddling in a trial second only in profile to the 1MDB scandal.

;

;Ahmad Zahid is a key member of Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim's administration, which pulls in erstwhile rivals from Umno and the Barisan Nasional (BN) coalition.

;

;Formerly a deputy to Prime Minister Najib Razak, Zahid was charged in 2018 with 47 counts of corruption, abuse of power and bribery involving more than 72 million ringgit (US$15.8 million) allegedly tied to his family-owned charity foundation.

;

;Malaysia's Umno struggles to juggle sinking Malay base, soft image as polls loom

;

;In a statement on Tuesday, Attorney General Idrus Harun said he removed Deputy Public Prosecutor (DPP) Raja Rozela Raja Toran from the case based on an application she made in April for early retirement.

;

;“The application was approved and will come into force on November 1, 2023,” Idrus said.

;

;Raja Rozela will be taking a leave of absence from August 30, he added.

;

;Helming the prosecution from the start in 2018, Raja Rozela steered the case through to January 2022 when the Kuala Lumpur High Court found the prosecution had established a prima facie case against the deputy prime minister, and ordered him to mount his defence.

;

;She is replaced by Dusuki Mokhtar, the head of the division in charge of public interest and high-profile cases, with more than 30 years of experience as a senior prosecutor.

;

;Before the attorney general's statement, Malaysia's untamed social media was abuzz with speculation over the sudden decision.

;

;Deputy chief of opposition party Bersatu's legal and constitution bureau Sasha Lyna Abdul Latif questioned Raja Rozela's removal at a critical juncture of the trial, saying it gives a negative perception of judicial freedom in Malaysia.

;

;“Any sign or perception that there has been interference or that the nation is soft on corruption will adversely affect our reputation as a place of business,” said Sasha Lyna, who is contesting the state elections on Saturday. “Nobody wants to do business with corrupt regimes.”

;

;Malaysia's Anwar names corruption-haunted Ahmad Zahid Hamidi as deputy PM

;

;Ahmad Zahid's return to the cabinet came following the stalemate result of the 2022 general election in November.

;

;His return to the fold has sparked a wave of speculation about what it means to the ongoing trial after he forged an unlikely alliance with Anwar Ibrahim's Pakatan Harapan (PH) coalition, which have been bitter enemies of his BN coalition since 1998.

;

;In July, the opposing Perikatan Nasional (PN) coalition accused Anwar of striking a deal to drop the charges against Ahmad Zahid in return for BN supporting Anwar's bid for the country's top office.

;

;Anwar said his appointment of the scandal-tainted Ahmad Zahid as his deputy last November meant that everyone is innocent until proven guilty. Anwar himself maintained his innocence throughout his incarceration in 1999 and again in 2014.

;

;The attorney general's explanation, however, did not quell speculation, with the Malaysian public pointing out that Idrus' predecessor Abdul Gani Patail was similarly removed from office under the guise of health reasons.

;That came after he attempted to arrest then prime minister Najib in 2016 for the 1MDB scandal.

;Hong Kong's first electric minibus, built by a city firm, will hit the roads by the end of this year as part of a drive towards green transport.

;

;The managing director of Shun Hing New Energy on Tuesday said its HK$2 million (US$256,000) Moonca model, the first approved by the Environmental Protection Department, was designed to plug into the emerging e-minibus market.

;

;Gary Ng Fuk-keung, who runs the Shun Hing Group subsidiary, added the new vehicle was a starting point to cash in on an inevitable move towards electric public transport.

;

;“We hope to break into the minibus market. This is the prevailing trend, that the city's minibuses will all be converted to electric vehicles sooner or later,” Ng said.

;

;“Each minibus will be sold at about HK$2 million each. We expect to deliver the first batch of vehicles by the end of this year.”

;

;The Shun Hing Group is one of the largest electrical appliance distributors in Hong Kong.

;

;The group's production of e-minibuses is part of the department's HK$80 million pilot scheme to promote electric public light buses.

;

;The government has subsidised 40 of the vehicles in one year, with 80 per cent of the cost covered.

;

;Those who missed out on the scheme can take advantage of the New Energy Transport Fund to get 50 per cent funding.

;

;Hong Kong tax breaks fuel big switch to electric cars, but where to charge them?

;

;Moonca, a 19-seater vehicle run by a high-efficiency lithium-titanate battery, is a joint venture by Shun Hing New Energy and Guangtong Automobile, a subsidiary of mainland firm Gree Altairnano New Energy.

;

;The vehicles can be charged through pantographs, a rooftop array connected to wires, or at charging stations, and batteries can be at 90 per cent capacity in about 18 minutes.

;

;A 10 minute charge is equivalent to 50km (31 miles) on the roads.

;

;Ng said the group was ready for mass production but operators might need to wait for the government to install more elevated charging spots at some interchange stations over next year.

;

;“Under the pilot scheme, we aim to produce about 20 Mooncas in about one year,” he said. “Of course, we hope to attract as many buyers as possible and get more orders when operators realise that our model will do good for their business.”

;

;Accelerate the drive towards electric cars

;

;The minibus pilot scheme was introduced after the government in 2021 set out its goal for carbon neutrality by 2050 to protect the environment.

;

;It unveiled a road map designed to popularise electric vehicles and phase out new purchases of internal combustion engine cars by 2035.

;

;The government said it would set out a timetable for the adoption of electric commercial vehicles in 2025 and was looking at carrying out trials for green public transport and haulage vehicles.

;

;Hong Kong has about 4,146 minibuses at present, including 3,299 green minibuses and 847 red ones.

;

;The government in 2018 introduced a range of tax breaks to encourage private car owners to trade in internal combustion engine vehicles for greener alternatives.

;
